attributes.action: Make schools remove climbing frames due to the health and safety of the children
attributes.background: I believe that climbing frames are a risk to the health and safety of children when used in a school playground environment. They are at risk of serious injury should they fall or are pushed by another child.
attributes.additional_details:
My daughter had an accident at her local Nursery when playing on the climbing frame, she fell from the top bar and then hit another bar seriously injuring her before she hit the ground.
I feel that children in a school environment are at a higher risk of injury from playing on a climbing frame than if they were playing on one in a park with their parents there to supervise.

attributes.action: Disability football should get more recognition
attributes.background: I Strongly Believe That Disability Football Should be Recognized more as a normal thing in society and that our government should support it more by supplying more funding and more publicity,
attributes.additional_details: Football can play a key role in any persons development let alone a disabled persons development, It can help them get Independence, socialize more and develop fine motor skills. Most football clubs run Disability football and it should get recognize more just like main stream football.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election at the start of 2017 with proportional representation.
attributes.background: This is a vote of no confidence in the current British Government in light of the EU Refurendum and is a call by the people to form a completely new government. With our prime minister stepping down and calling for new leadership we feel that this should be decided by all the people not by the few.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a significant proportion of people who are upset with the outcome of the referendum and over 2 million are petitioning for another. 

There is a strong majority that feel that their opinions, ideologies and voices are not heard due to our current first past post political popularity contest. 

With a 72% vote on the referendum, people are more politically minded than ever and we should utilise this opportunity to elect a government of the people proportionally elected by the people.

attributes.action: Debate within 100 days the Government's costed plan for the UK to leave the EU
attributes.background: Good governance requires such a momentous change of national direction to be underpinned by a properly formulated plan with specific objectives, milestones for the change process and timescales for final delivery, detailed costings and an associated risk management plan.
attributes.additional_details: The people of the United Kingdom must be informed of the plan and its detail debated in Parliament within 100 days.

attributes.action: RAISE Tariffs on IMPORTED steel to keep British Steel ALIVE.
attributes.background: Our manufacturing sector has been decimated over decades of neglect and a sense of simply not caring. A strong manufacturing sector constitutes a resilient, strong, diverse and booming economy. WE NEED MORE THAN JUST SERVICES. We can begin by raising tariffs on imported, cheap steel.
attributes.additional_details: Our Steel Industry has been decimated over the years by cheap Chinese and other low labour cost nation imports. LEVY IT. This will promote projects within the UK to use British Steel thus reviving the industry, producing jobs and a renewed sense of pride within ourselves. Moreover, to support and kick start this I want capital, state projects to ONLY use British Steel. Beginning with HS2 and other ongoing projects. I believe this will boost economic output and GDP and benefit us all immensely.

attributes.action: For Armed Forces Veterans become Priority to housing, benefits and hospitals
attributes.background: For Government to acknowledge the fact that they have Veterans who are homeless and have mental issues due to their time in the forces and to give them priority

attributes.action: Allow immigrants to vote in UK national elections and referendums.
attributes.background: The scapegoating of immigrants during political campaigns narrows the debate, hides the true reasons for economic problems, and distorts the result. If immigrants were granted the vote, as they are in local elections, they would not be targeted in this way.
attributes.additional_details: During the 18 September 2014 referendum on Scottish independence, all EU and Commonwealth citizens resident in Scotland aged 16 or over could vote. During the 23rd June 2016 referendum on the UK's membership of the EU, immigrants from the EU were not allowed to vote, though commonwealth citizens were. The campaign focussed unduly on the issue of immigration to the detriment of other important issues.

attributes.action: Reintroduce the Migration Impact Fund
attributes.background: The first Cameron ministry scraped the Migration Impact Fund in 2010. The Â£50million fund was set up by the Brown ministry to help local government deal with the effects of pressure of high levels of immigration. By reintroducing this fund we can ensure that migration benefits everyone in society.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2010/aug/06/fund-impact-immigration-scrapped

attributes.action: Control immigration to prevent overpopulation and economic depression
attributes.background: Immigration is becoming a big issue in Europe and even bigger in the UK. With current immigration levels the UK is on the path to extreme overpopulation which could mean even more strain on services such as the NHS, Housing, public transportation and almost all other public services will be affected
attributes.additional_details:
The guardian on overpopulation in Britain: http://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/feb/09/is-britain-full-home-truths-about-population-panic
Top 10 overpopulated countries (including UK(3rd party)):
http://www.newstatesman.com/blogs/the-staggers/2010/07/population-index-overpopulated
Overpopulation is clearly a highly likely event in the UK unless the government is blind to see the high population increase in the UK then they should be doing more to delay it or prevent it.

attributes.action: Allow retirement with State Pension if people worked 40 years and contributed.
attributes.background: Loads of people have worked all of their lives and never claimed benefits, we now see retirement ages get further away. If they have worked all of their lives and paid taxes and NI  for 40 years  they should be allowed to retire with state pension irrespective of age..

attributes.action: Stop British Government discriminating against people with Disabilities
attributes.background: Cody has been on ancestral visa, he has now applied for indefinite leave to remain. Part of this application is a life in the UK test and an English test. Cody has documentary proof that he suffers from severe Dyslexia and Specific Language Impairment. The Government has denied him an excemption.
attributes.additional_details: Under their own rules he should have been granted an exception. Cody has now been refused indefinite leave to remain due to not sitting the test. This is a blatant discriminatory act against people with Disabilities. Under the UK Disabilities Act of 2010. Please support this petition otherwise this means deportation where he has no family or friends with no means of support.

attributes.action: Fully fund University Education for priority careers e.g. Health,Sciences Eng...
attributes.background: We desperately need Doctors, Scientists, Engineers, yet every year we fail to train in sufficient numbers whilst pumping out graduates in law, media, politics, travel and more exotic topics which rarely lead to careers where our society needs them most.
attributes.additional_details:
We must encourage more students entering higher education to consider where society needs them most by offering to fully fund their academic fees on the basis that they first qualify and then agree to work in their chosen field here in the UK for a minimum of 10 years after qualifying or the fee's - based on a sliding scale will be recoverable.
These publicly funded places should be offered entirely to satisfy the needs of our society and no other consideration should be evaluated or allowed.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for an employer to impose gender specific dress codes on staff.
attributes.background: Many companies have dress codes, or uniform guidelines, which their employees must follow. Many elements are based on gender stereotypes, and it is common practise to have different standards for male and female. Elements may include; headwear, shoes, skirts/trousers, make-up and hair styles.
attributes.additional_details: Most companies in the service and corporate sector have strict uniform guidelines that include elements like; Women must wear skirts, men must wear trousers. Women must wear make-up, men must not wear make-up. Women are allowed long hair styles, men are allowed only short hair styles. If an employee does not comply with the uniform guidelines, as per their predefined gender, the employee will be subject to disciplinary procedure which may include dismissal. The aim with this petition is to make it a legal requirement for the employer to remove all gender references in regards to company dress and grooming standards, and that any imposed standard may be followed by any employee regardless of the employeesâ gender association.

attributes.action: Stop charging extortionate Child Visa fees and NHS Surcharges
attributes.background: Dependent children of Non-EU immigrants are charged same visa fees and NHS levy as adults. It is appalling that child visa fee in a temporary visa category is as much as Â£1790+ Â£200 NHS levy/year. They are not entitled to any kind of state benefits in the UK and shouldnât be charged hefty visa fees
attributes.additional_details: If a Non-EU family of 4, 2 adults and 2 toddlers, needs to extend their stay in UK for 2 years, they would pay Â£7160 Visa + Biometric fees and Â£1600 NHS levy. Visa fee is irrespective of how short is their stay, means if an immigrantâs spouse and a child granted 6 months visa they would still pay Â£3580 in visa fees only. Fair fees are part of business ethics and Governments are also expected to conduct their business ethically. Be ethical and considerate and abolish child visa fees and NHS Levy

attributes.action: Allow regions of England  to hold a referendum on regional  assemblies
attributes.background: the recent revelations of the panama papers highlights the Westminster bubble i feel power should devolved into the hands of the people, it would give  a greater voice to regions such as the north and the midlands who are not being represented by a London focused Westminster
attributes.additional_details: i am aware john Prescott attempted something similarly in the past but the direct democracy of regional assembly remains the way forward as these assemblies would be better placed to dealing with local issues and would more accountable to the voters giving the proximity to them it would also ease the load on central government the is already support for regional assembles in England http://www.wessexregionalists.info/ and http://www.thenortheastparty.org.uk/

attributes.action: SIA frontline officers to be granted with more power and equipted with PPE
attributes.background: Security Officers deal with violent and aggressive and drunken individuals each day, thus they are vulnerable in frontline. They have no powers apart from Common Law powers and have no Personal Protective Equipment.
attributes.additional_details: Each day we see in media of security officers been attacked,stabbed or even more been killed. We are asking government to grant powers to Security Officers and make Personal Protective Equipment mandatory throught the industry. This way, our security officer colleagues will be safe in frontline.

attributes.action: hold a referendum on  giving 0.7% of GDP in foreign aid.
attributes.background: Call on the British government to hold a referendum on giving 0.7% of GDP to foreign aid

attributes.action: Implement & enforce an improved code of professional conduct for MPs in session.
attributes.background:
Revise the MPs code of conduct to include:
Respect
Driving positive behaviours
Setting the example of professional conduct
Reinforcing to the public that MPs work for a shared goal, regardless of party allegiance
Presenting sessions of the British parliament in a positive light to the World
attributes.additional_details:
MPs have a duty and obligation to us, the electorate, to set the standards of positive British values.  Jeering, laughing, mocking, name calling, shouting etc would not be tolerated in day to day life and should not be accepted during sessions of parliament.  Many of these in fact constitute bullying.

A thorough reform of policy / conduct is required to improve behavior by those elected to represent us, with ongoing powers to enforce and hold those in breech to account.  Promote British Values.

attributes.action: Raise motorway speed limit to 80mph with a minimum of 55mph.
attributes.background: We advocate raising the speed limit on motorways and dual carriage-ways from 70mph to 80mph and setting a minimum speed of 55mph to reduce impeding the flow of traffic and cause of sudden braking.
attributes.additional_details: Motorway speed limits were originally designed in the days when vehicles could not break in time. We advocate raising the motorway limit to 80mph. Drivers travelling under 50mph impede the flow of traffic, cause a nuisance to other drivers and can cause vehicles to have to brake hard increasing the chance of an accident.

attributes.action: Make disability awareness a regular thing taught in schools
attributes.background:
As a 14 yr old teenager with cerebral palsy who uses a wheelchair I know that bullying can be a regular thing for disabled people.

I believe that something needs to be done therefore we need to teach more young people about disability in order to reduce bullying and ultimately lack of awareness

attributes.action: Make it illegal to smoke within 20 metres of a school during school hours
attributes.background:
As a parent, I find it disgusting that when taking my child to school, I have to take my child though clouds of cigarette smoke.

I am not anti-smoking, but I do believe that it should not be forced on children. When parents stand outside a school and are smoking, the kids suffer as a result.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm an ex-smoker and believe that smokers have rights. However, children have a right to not be subjected to cigarette smoke right outside a centre for education.

Every day when I take my son to school, there are groups of parents in a haze of cigarette smoke, and it's unavoidable. If parents cannot show restraint for the health of their children, then the Government should intervene and make it a criminal offence.

attributes.action: Release Government knowledge of extraterrestrials
attributes.background: The amount of sightings and people coming forward about interaction with beings of the years must mean the government be aware of it and keep information.  The release of of so called secret files by the MOD  was low level rubbish.  It's time for the truth. We have been lied too long enough.

attributes.action: David Cameron to acknowledge that Freemantle statistics have been misrepresented
attributes.background: The changes being imposed by the government regarding the Junior Doctor contract are based around the Freemantle Paper into weekend hospital admissions. The government frequently use these figures to justify claims for their changes to contracts which directly contradicts the authors conclusions.
attributes.additional_details:
The authors report 11,000 deaths on Friday, Saturday, Sunday and Monday admissions compared to the other days. They also note there is a higher proportion of "unwell" patients. They do not suggest these are avoidable.  A paper published by Lord Darzi this year looking at avoidability of hospital deaths suggests that only 3.6% are avoidable. 

The Prime Minister must abide by medical research ethics and confirm that the goverment are misrepresenting data for political kudos.

attributes.action: Direct Councils to use the Mobile Home powers devolved to them, without option.
attributes.background: A 'criminal element' have been acquiring Sites. They use brutal intimidation to frighten elderly residents and they ignore any regulations. Although Councils have enormous powers under Planning and Licencing  they are reluctant to get involved, even when there is overwhelming evidence.
attributes.additional_details:
The main legislation is the 1960 Caravan Act, the 1983  Mobile Home Act and the 2013 Mobile Home Act. Councils have been lethargic and even negligent in their policing of these Acts. 

There is a Parliamentary Working Group monitoring the 2013 Act, but they are not going to report until July 2017. The legislation must be made to work now and the rouges must either change their ways, or be relieved of the ownership of their Sites. Too many elderly residents are suffering hardship and abuse.

attributes.action: Stop the child tax credit cuts for a third child born from 6th April 2017.
attributes.background: This policy would lead to child poverty and charities are concerned that this would result in poverty and generations of lower classes whereby this right is only for the privileged. Those who said we are all in it together can not implement this policy. Thereby we urge the government to review this.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.childrenssociety.org.uk/sites/default/files/The%20Childrens%20Society%20-%20two%20child%20limit%20supplementary%20evidence.docx

http://www.barnardos.org.uk/poverty_full_report_07.pdf

attributes.action: Change the house buying process in England, Wales and NI
attributes.background: A petition to address the requirement of consumer protection when purchasing or selling a property. Minimising financial exposure and risk after price agreement and the subsequent common terms of sale changes; gazumping, gazundering and pulling out. MPs to create safeguards in earlier commitment.

attributes.action: To make the use of the word "midget" a hate crime.
attributes.background: The use of the word "midget" is used as a hate crime directed at people of short stature. People with restricted growth, frequently experience others insulting them either directly or indirectly with the inappropriate word "midget". This must stop! It is cruel and vile and has no place in society.
attributes.additional_details:
Restricted growth is commonly described as having a final adult height of 4â10â or less due to a medical condition.
Most people who have restricted growth have it due to a genetic condition. There are estimated to be several hundred conditions that can cause restricted growth, these can cause proportionate or disproportionate, such as Achondroplasia, restricted growth.

attributes.action: Work with major chains to ban non-recyclable coffee cups ending up in landfill
attributes.background: In the UK over 2.5 billion take-away coffee cups are placed in landfill every year. The public are wrongly led to believe that these cups are actually recyclable (i.e. through environment friendly logos on the packaging). This is a major issue resulting in huge amounts of waste
attributes.additional_details:
'A conservative estimate puts the number of paper cups handed out by coffee shops in the UK at 3bn, more than 8m a day. Yet, supposedly, fewer than one in 400 is being recycled'.

I propose that the Government actively works with major coffee chains and retailers to explore the use of environmentally friendly coffee cups. As part of this, non-recyclable cups should be banned or a tax placed on them to encourage the use of 'cups for life' and bringing in a national awareness of the problem.

attributes.action: The government is to declassify all plans on TTIP & make plans available online
attributes.background: Such a large trade deal should be available for all the public to read and scrutinise, why is it that we are having to request this information into the public eye. We want this information to be accessible to all people, as we all know the consequences of deals made outside the democratic arena.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transatlantic_Trade_and_Investment_Partnership

attributes.action: Fair and regulated pricing for EV charging points within the UK.
attributes.background: Ecotricity today 7th July 2016 increased the price of EV charging from free to Â£5 per a 20 minute charge. They apparently consulted EV drivers and consider this to be a fair price. The new pricing makes long distance travel not economically viable with an EV.

attributes.action: Stay in the EU, enact Proportional Representation, and call a General Election
attributes.background:
Following the referendum on the UKâs membership of the EU, we the undersigned call upon the British government to:

1. Reject the outcome of the referendum and formally state that the UK wishes to remain in the EU.

2. Enact Proportional Representation.

3. Call a General Election.

attributes.action: All NHS employers to pay staff at least the living wage.
attributes.background: Some of the lowest paid NHS staff are working below the living wage. Please sign and support this petition

attributes.action: Call a referendum so London can decide to be part of the UK or remain in the EU.
attributes.background:
London, as defined by all postal codes with a LONDON prefix, voted by overwhelming majority in the recent European referendum to remain part of the EU.  

We, the undersigned, believe that London should be allowed to decide its own future as separate from the rest of the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
London and its population has stronger ties to Europe than it does to England.  e.g. our dependence on financial services.

London voted by a similar margin in favour of Remain as Scotland.  By the same right that Scotland has to now decide its future, so does London. 

Our population is significantly more European and culturally diverse than the rest of the UK.

London gives more to the UK in tax revenue than the UK gives to London.  We would be stronger if financially independent.

attributes.action: Veto Turkey joining the EU until they cease their illegal occupation of Cyprus
attributes.background: In July 1974, Turkish forces twice invaded and captured the island of Cyprus and now illegally occupy 40% of it. Cyprus is a member of the EU and Turkey wish to join. Countries that occupy member states illegally cannot join the EU but Turkey will be allowed to unless it is vetoed.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_invasion_of_Cyprus

attributes.action: Create a memorial or name a room within the Palace of Westminster after Jo Cox
attributes.background: Jo Cox MP was a Member of Parliament who dedicated the past year to her community and often fought for more things for Young people. In the memory of her life I propose that the Palace of Westminster name an area, room or dedicate a memorial to her life in her memory.

attributes.action: Ban the transportation and slaughter of pregnant sows
attributes.background: Tired, terrified and heavily pregnant sows are being transported to abattoirs and  frequently give birth during this harrowing journey.
attributes.additional_details: For many piglets their initial experience of this world consists of lying helplessly on the floor of a vehicle which is carting their mother off to slaughter or falling through slats onto the road below.

attributes.action: Scrap the tv licence fee of Â£145.50 and change it for an NHS fee for Â£145.50 phh
attributes.background: We're always saying we have not got enough money for the NHS well let the bbc pay for itself by advertising and change the fee for a NHS fee set in the same format as the TV licence by each household paying either yearly quarterly monthly or weekly. I know what I would rather pay for

attributes.action: Change this petitions site to enable a motion to be voted FOR or AGAINST.
attributes.background: In parliament it is customary to conclude a vote with ayes to the right and nos to the left. It is therefore remarkable that e-committee members have not followed established convention by introducing a flawed system vulnerable to distortion according to the relative publicity given to a motion.
attributes.additional_details:
Every motion should have the option of a positive or negative vote as demonstrated by the recent Donald Trump issue where much press coverage was given to the âBan Trumpâ motion in contrast to the âDonât ban Trumpâ motion which was almost unknown due to minimal coverage.  

Whilst the e-petition system should enable members of parliament gain better understanding of the public opinion they are representing, it is fundamental that a conventional resilient and unbiased voting system be adopted.

attributes.action: More beds available in the Burnley/ Blackburn mental health inpatient units
attributes.background: Too many people lose their lives due to the lack of resources within the mental health sector. One of the biggest problems arising at the moment is the lack of beds available in the Lancashire inpatient mental health units. These beds could save the lives of those who need immediate help.

attributes.action: Ban Angela Merkel from entering the UK.
attributes.background: More innocent people have been killed by terrorists, this time in Brussels. There have been more attacks since Angela Merkel opened her arms to immigrants, some of which have been proven to have been terrorists. The vetting process has been inadequate. This will only get worse without action!

attributes.action: Use the Sugar Tax income to fund a Healthy Foods Voucher scheme for all.
attributes.background: Poor nutrition in our country often comes down to affordability. A Healthy Foods Voucher Scheme, funded by the Sugar Tax income, would make healthy foods more affordable. These vouchers could include Vegetables, Fruit, Eggs, Meat and Fish for all households and be exchangeable by any grocery outlet.

attributes.action: Take Military Action against ISIL both here in the UK and abroad.
attributes.background: In light of the recent terrorist attacks in France and Germany, I would call upon the UK Government to take Military Action against ISIL both here in Britain and Abroad.

attributes.action: Require that MPs leaving their political party resign their seat immediately.
attributes.background:
This gives the electorate of that constituency the proper opportunity to express their mandate again, rather than having to wait for the next general election. 

It also provides the resigning MP with a mandate to continue (as an independent, or in another party), should they be re-elected.

attributes.action: Ensure there are dedicated disability wards for over 18s in hospitals
attributes.background: Our beautiful disabled daughter/Sister age 26 died of Pneumonia and we think the care of the ward could of been a lot better if there was a dedicated ward with 1 to 1 care and trained disability nurses!

attributes.action: Introduce a jury system so family's fighting forced adoption have a fair trial
attributes.background: Fighting social services on forced adoption, give families a fair say and the options to explore every solution on earth to make changes to keep families together.
attributes.additional_details: Adoption is so final and social services play God with children's lives forced adoption is barbaric

attributes.action: Make it an offence to park a motor vehicle on a public footpath.
attributes.background: Vehicles obstructing the public footpath, are breaking the law, to enable a vehicle to park in such a way, the vehicle has driven to its position, driving on the footpath is illegal. Pedestrians on many occasions have to walk into traffic to pass these vehicles obstructing the footpath.
attributes.additional_details: Section 34(1) of the Road Traffic Act 1988 (RTA 1988) provides that anyone driving a mechanically propelled vehicle, for example a motor car, on a road that is a footpath, bridleway or restricted byway is guilty of an offence unless it can be shown that there is a private right in place for people to use the accessway to gain vehicular access to their property. The burden of proving that there is such a vehicular right of way in place rests with the defendant.

attributes.action: Call a General Election in 2017.  Brexit needs a plan with an electoral mandate.
attributes.background:
A referendum vote to leave and "take our freedom back" is not a plan - its a protest. We need a plan on how we leave and what we do next.
This plan should have an electoral mandate from us all - Brexiteers and Remainers alike. 
That is the only way to can build a new unity and a strong future.
attributes.additional_details:
We need three things ASAP:
1. The parties (old guard, and maybe new?) should propose their Brexit plan. 
2. A General Election should be called soon - ideally Spring 2017.
3. The plan people want most will receive a proper mandate.
We can make something good happen. We will have to look beyond our party allegiances to do so. Please get stuck in. Share, like, petition, .... or come up with something better than this.

attributes.action: Ban lorries from overtaking on dual carriageways, and motorways between 7am-7pm
attributes.background:
We've all been stuck on a dual carriageway doing fifty behind a lorry driver who feel they need to overtake another lorry doing two or three miles per hour less than them.

The same happens on motorways and causes the same issues when a somebody tries to overtake both of those lorries at sixty.
attributes.additional_details:
It clogs up road which are designed to be freely moving and can cause miles of tailbacks.

Even more frustrating is when as soon as they have finished their overtake they take the exit off the road.

My proposal is to ban lorries from overtaking on a dual carriageway at any time, and a ban on lorries overtaking between 7am and 7pm on motorways.

If you agree please sign.

attributes.action: Remove the Barnett Formula from being applied in the UK
attributes.background: The Barnett Formula does not conform with modern equality as it allow some groups to benefit and others not. We should all be subject to the same rules
attributes.additional_details: No evidence is needed as all facts are published by the UK government

attributes.action: Allow a second referendum on the subject of our membership of the European Union
attributes.background: We believe that the "In" or "Out" choice was too simplistic for a decision of such importance and that clear and unbiased information was not available. We believe that we should have been asked additionally, or instead, "Would you chose to remain within a substantially reformed European Union"?
